snippet: The retailer also said it was ending its joint venture with Bharti Enterprises to operate 20 wholesale stores in India and will buy out its partner’s stake.
abstract: Walmart Stores gives up on India's huge market, saying it has indefinitely delayed its once-ambitious plans to open hundreds of superstores across country; also says it is ending its joint venture with Bharti Enterprises to operate 20 wholesale stores in India and will buy out its partner’s stake.

byline.contributor: Neha Thirani Bagri contributed reporting from Mumbai, and Malavika Vyawahare from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: The retailer also said it was ending its joint venture with Bharti Enterprises to operate 20 wholesale stores in India and will buy out its partner’s stake.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Drops Ambitious Expansion Plan for India
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Drops Ambitious Expansion Plan for India
